graph.prim

Class Prim

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.prim.Prim

  • public class Prim
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements Prim's algorithm for finding the maximal/minimum spanning tree in a directed graph.
    Author:
    Matthew Bernstein - matthewb@cs.wisc.edu

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int FIRST_VERTEX
      Denotes the ID of the first vertex to use when constructing the tree
      static java.lang.Double NO_EDGE
      Denotes a non-existant edge in the adjacency matrix

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Prim() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void addPotentialEdges(java.lang.Double[][] graph, java.lang.Integer newVertex, java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> vInTree, java.util.PriorityQueue<Edge> potentialEdges)
      Adds all edges incident to a new vertex in the spanning tree to the queue containing all potential edges that may be added to the spanning tree in the future.
      static java.util.ArrayList<Edge> runPrims(java.lang.Double[][] graph)
      Run Prim's algorithm on a graph to find the maximal/minimal spanning tree.

        public Prim()

    • Method Detail

      • runPrims

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Edge> runPrims(java.lang.Double[][] graph)
        Run Prim's algorithm on a graph to find the maximal/minimal spanning tree.
        Parameters:
        graph - an adjacency matrix representing the existing graph. Weights are specified by Double objects. Null objects represent non-existant edges.
        Returns:
        a list of edges representing the resulting spanning tree.

      • addPotentialEdges

        public static void addPotentialEdges(java.lang.Double[][] graph,
                     java.lang.Integer newVertex,
                     java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> vInTree,
                     java.util.PriorityQueue<Edge> potentialEdges)
        Adds all edges incident to a new vertex in the spanning tree to the queue containing all potential edges that may be added to the spanning tree in the future.
        Parameters:
        graph - - the original graph
        newVertex - - the new vertex to the spanning tree
        vInTree - - a set of all vertices already in the spanning tree
        potentialEdges - - the set of potential edges to the spanning tree
